instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COPMUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COPMUTING_ISNS? This is a typo of PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS When you see PPBUS_S5_HS_COPMUTING_ISNS, assume they meant to type PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a quarter fan spin nothing else
threads.message:
MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a quarter fan spin nothing else, no water damage, battery looks swollen.

SMC reset did noting.

Light turns green when charger is plugged in, then it turns orange, fan spins for a second or so then it stops, a few seconds go by then it spins again for one second and it repeats.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.4
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> 8.4
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COPMUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> 8.4
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 15.07
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.42
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.32

threads.title: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a quarter fan spin nothing else
threads.message:
If fan spins, board is in S0 state.
Check if you get voltage on all big coils in that moment.

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> goes high?
Any pulse at <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, pins 7 & 3?
Check for corrosion around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>.

Can you start in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a quarter fan spin nothing else
threads.message: Also check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>

threads.title: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a quarter fan spin nothing else
threads.message:
If fan spins, board is in S0 state.

Check if you get voltage on all big coils in that moment.
Sorry, what big coils, Im still learning the parts names, Im a newbie.

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> goes high? Pulses from 0 to 3.3v
Any pulse at <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, pins 7 & 3? I could not find <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> on this board
Check for corrosion around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>. [LEFT][COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]<CHIP>U6100</CHIP> looked okay but not great so I re solder it, <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> looks great and <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> does not exists in thisboard.[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]
 

Can you start in SMC bypass mode?

Yes, but the only difference is that the fan spins at full sped rather than slow-medium speed.

threads.title: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a quarter fan spin nothing else
threads.message:
[QUOTE="JohnB8812, post: 46971"]Also check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>[/QUOTE]

I cloould not find [LEFT][COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> on this board[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a quarter fan spin nothing else
threads.message:
"I could not find <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> on this board"
Mea culpa; Apple use that chip number in many schematics.
In your board is <CHIP>U2750</CHIP>.

"I cloould not find
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> on this board[/FONT][/COLOR]"
Nor on page 53 (<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>)???

In SMC bypass mode, board stays on, or restarts too?

Any history available?

threads.title: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a quarter fan spin nothing else
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 47003"]"I could not find <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> on this board"
Mea culpa; Apple use that chip number in many schematics.
In your board is <CHIP>U2750</CHIP>.

"I cloould not find
[COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> on this board[/FONT][/COLOR]"
Nor on page 53 (<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>)???

In SMC bypass mode, board stays on, or restarts too?

Any history available?[/QUOTE]

In <CHIP>U2750</CHIP> the only pin with voltage is pin 5 with a steady 3.3v not pulsing

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> Pins 17-18 resistance is 90.2 ko and 27-28 is 1.018 ko

SMC Bypass the fan spins at top speed for about 1 second or so and repeats, same thing as the original problem, but faster fan speed, nothing else happens.

Im puzzled!

threads.title: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a quarter fan spin nothing else
threads.message:
"<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> Pins 17-18 resistance is 90.2 ko and 27-28 is 1.018 ko"
Are these values between pins???
In such case you must check <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22 and <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52.
Be aware, we didn't ask about values to ground.

Please, do NOT quote an entire message visible few centimeters above; maintain forum aesthetic...

threads.title: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a quarter fan spin nothing else
threads.message: Your issue is current sensing then pins 17/18 27/28. Make sure the traces between the ISL and <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>/50 are good. If so, replace all that is blown <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/2, <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/2, <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>/50, and the ISL as well.

threads.title: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a quarter fan spin nothing else
threads.message:
Yes resistance was measured between pins and not to ground, I replaced [LEFT][COLOR=#353535][FONT=inherit]<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/2, <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/2, <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>/50, and the ISL,but now I dont even have a green light and no more fan spin. 

Since a lot of terms are new to me I am taking LR course about basic electronics, thanks for bearing with me.[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a quarter fan spin nothing else
threads.message: One thing I noticed before and after replacing the components is that pins 17 and 18 are shorted or have continuity.

threads.title: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a quarter fan spin nothing else
threads.message: Ok removed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and the green light came back and it turns orange, no fan spin and pins 17-18 are shorted as well as pins 27-28.

threads.title: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a quarter fan spin nothing else
threads.message:
You MUST have practically short there (between pins); 20 ohms and 2.2 ohms respectively.
But cannot have short, nor low value respect to ground.

Is now <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> removed?
Replace it and do NOT powre MLB again with missing chips from power supplies.
Usually nothing happens in case of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, but do NOT do that for a secondary power supply!!!

threads.title: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a quarter fan spin nothing else
threads.message: If pins 17/18 and 27/28 measure 20 and 2.2, then they are NOT shorted they are exactly as they should measure. Replace the ISL properly and remeasure before powering it up. If all checks out, see if it powers on.
